metadata.title: CVE-2017-7011 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.3 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.2 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to spoof the address bar via acrafted web site that uses FRAME elements.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.6-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.16.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.6-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
